properties.areaDesc: San Juan County; Western Whatcom County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 3:21AM PST until January 15 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
continued. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. For the Winter
Storm Watch, heavy snow and very cold wind chills possible.
Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Winds could
gust as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...San Juan County, including Stuart Island, Waldron
Island, Orcas Island, San Juan Island, Lopez Island, Blakely
Island, and Decatur Island and Lowlands of western Whatcom
County, including Point Roberts, Lummi Island, Bellingham, and
Sumas.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM PST this
morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. There is a danger of
frostbite for exposed skin for people outside.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
